info.name: Headerbar Style Toolbar
info.description: Arranges primary toolbar to look like a Gnome 3.10 headerbar for better Gnome Shell integration.
info.additionalInfo:
Installation Instructions
  1. Install required extensions (see below).
  2. Set browser.tabs.onTop to false in about:config to disable tabs on top.
  3. Arrange toolbar as in the screenshot. Do not forget to place Flexible Space on both sides of the omnibar. This will alow you to drag the maximized window by its headerbar, just like in Epiphany. Also do not forget to use large icons. You may hide any toolbars except the Navigation Toolbar and the Ominbar in Urlbar.
  4. Install this user style and enjoy the Gnome 3.10 look!
Required Extensions
  • GNOME 3 Theme
  • GNOME Theme Tweak to relief toolbar buttons.
  • HTitle for the close button.
  • FxButton for the "gear" menubutton.
  • Omnibar for the unified location/search bar.
  • Status-4-Evar if you want to hide the status bar and display loading progress in the url bar (as far as I know, an Epiphany-style progress meter below the tab bar is currently impossible).
  • Download Statusbar if you want to remove the Downloads button and use a Chrome/Epiphany-style download statusbar.
Limitations Firefox is not a Gnome 3 application, therefore it does not have a real headerbar. With the HTitle extension a headerbar may be emulated. However, when the Firefox window is not maximized, a regular titlebar will be shown in addition to the headerbar. Changelog
  • 2013.10.28.: Improved maximized headerbar border.
  • 2014.01.22.: Minor appearance tweaks.
